I studied abroad in Barcelona for 3 months and Bodega was the best Tapas place I encountered.  I want to preface that it is not a cheap eat.  The tapas are pretty small in comparison to what you might find at other spots, but it's worth the slightly pricier menu.  We always stuck to the classics and were not dissapointed.  The best patas bravas for sure with a layer of flavors and nicely thin cut potatoes.  The star of every meal is the squid mollette.  Similar to a calamari hot-dog or like the calamari sandwiches you find in Madrid, but so much better!  After my first bite, I ordered another before the waitress left the table.  The place isn't super fancy to look at and the hours are a little random, but the amazing food and superb service make this a must!  Sad to be back in the U.S. and not within a walk of this spot anymore =(
